intro: Manisuris afzelii, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough, hairy texture. Manisuris afzelii thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often growing in open woodlands or along riverbanks.
